item.title: Julie add a quote by Torey Hayden
item.description: "Perhaps the greatest magic of the human spirit is the ability to laugh, at ourselves, at each other, and at our sometimes hopeless situation. Laughter normalized our lives" -- Torey Hayden

item.title: Julie add a quote by Walter Dean Myers
item.description: "It's a hard life sometimes and the biggest temptation is to let how hard it is be an excuse to weaken" -- Walter Dean Myers

item.title: Julie add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "There are depths to the human soul that should not be fathomed." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Julie add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "Rape is a crime against sleep and memory; it's afterimage imprints itself like an irreversible negative from the camera obscura of dreams." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Julie add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Julie add a quote by Rodman Philbrick
item.description: "Remembering is a great invention of the mind." -- Rodman Philbrick

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "...motherhood should be like driving a car -- you should have to pass a test before you can do it legally." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "But no one walks out of his family without reprisals: a family is too disciplined an army to offer compassion to its deserters." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "Sometimes you've got to shout the truth and wake people up." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "Like my grandmother always said, 'you never know the blessings that come from suffering." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "You've got to love yourself with all your short comings, and you've got to love the world no matter how bad it gets." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Memory is the happiness of being alone." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Julie add a quote by Betsy Byars
item.description: "It was as if her life was a huge kaleidoscope, and the kaleidoscope had been turned and now everything was changed. The same stones shaken, no longer made the same design." -- Betsy Byars

item.title: Julie add a quote by Robert Cormier
item.description: "It doesn't matter how big the body, it's what you do with it." -- Robert Cormier

item.title: Julie add a quote by Nancy Garden
item.description: "The thing about mountains is that you have to keep on climbing them, and that it's always hard, but there's a view from top every time when you finally get there." -- Nancy Garden

item.title: Julie add a quote by Robert Cormier
item.description: "It's amazing that the heart makes no noise when it cracks." -- Robert Cormier

item.title: Julie add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "Sometimes it take courage to leave." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "Staring down hard truth takes guts." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My father always told me that in this world we are going to make a truckload of mistakes, but the best mistake we can ever make is to err on the side of mercy" -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "No story is a straight line. The geometry of a human life is too imperfect and complex, too distorted by the laughter of time and the bewildering intricacies of fate to admit the straight line into its system of laws." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Julie add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "Let me say the good are often punished unfairly." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Julie add a quote by Rodman Philbrick
item.description: "Pain is just a state of mind. You can think your way out of everything, even pain." -- Rodman Philbrick

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "You cannot measure the loss of a human life. It's all the things a person was, all their dreams, all the people who loved them, all they hoped to be and could give back to the world." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Chris Crutcher
item.description: "...racist thought and action says far more about the person they come from than the person they are directed at." -- Chris Crutcher

item.title: Julie add a quote by Walter Dean Myers
item.description: "Sometimes when things get hard, we tend to set our sights on what's hard, that difficult thing that keeps us upset, and we turn our back on our strengths. " -- Walter Dean Myers

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "They marched. Not for themselves. They marched to remember the ones who didn't make it back. They marched because seeing so much loss can teach you about life. they marched because we're all fighting a war whether we know it or not...a war for our minds and souls and what we believe in." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "The problem with the heart is how it can have so many opposite feelings coursing through it all at the same time. It's really an inconsistent thing- appreciating something one minute and hating it the next. " -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Julie add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Julie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Julie add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
